meanings.sent1: The decision to fire him was unwarrantable as he did nothing wrong.
meanings.sent2: Her unwarrantable behavior caused a lot of trouble.
meanings.sent3: It was quite unwarrantable for him to eat all the cookies before the party.
meanings.sent4: The unwarrantable noise coming from the construction site kept everyone awake.
meanings.sent5: The teacher found his excuse for not doing homework completely unwarrantable.

meanings.sent1: The use of the company's logo without permission was unwarrantable.
meanings.sent2: His unwarrantable entry into the restricted area led to his arrest.
meanings.sent3: It was unwarrantable for him to take the car without asking.
meanings.sent4: The unwarrantable access to classified information raised security concerns.
meanings.sent5: The unwarrantable use of the emergency exit caused chaos in the building.

meanings.sent1: The decision to cut down the ancient tree was unwarrantable.
meanings.sent2: Her unwarrantable accusations caused a rift in the family.
meanings.sent3: It seemed unwarrantable to him that he had to pay for a mistake he didn't make.
meanings.sent4: The unwarrantable delay in the project led to significant losses.
meanings.sent5: The unwarrantable destruction of evidence jeopardized the entire case.
